author: Special Correspondent
text:
The striking government employees are not satisfied with Chief Minister Jayalalithaa’s announcements as there seems to be no immediate solution to any of their 20-point charter of demands.

About 3.5 lakh government employees of 68 departments affiliated to the Tamil Nadu Government Employees Association (TNGEA) have been protesting for the past 10 days. Asked about the announcements, R. Balasubramanian, general secretary, TNGEA, said, “Our demands have not been fully accepted. There are announcements but none of them will solve our demands immediately.”

“The TNGEA struggle committee, however, will meet on Saturday and decide whether to continue the strike or not,” he added.Noon-meal worker dies

In Dharmapuri, a noon-meal worker suffered a cardiac arrest and was rushed to the government medical college hospital. She was part of 500 women employees who were staging a sit-in outside the Collectorate on Thursday night.

This is secondincident of cardiac arrest of government employee in the protest site.

In southern districts, the protests caused no significant hindrance to the public.
title: TN employees unhappy; to take decision today
